title: Hammam mein sab...: Why Trump is untouched by Epstein files
description: Trump appears in the Epstein files in a strangely spectral way. His name is everywhere, but his voice is nowhere. The numbers point to administrative change more than a uniform national trend, raising questions about how the official school map is being reshaped locally.

description: The Central government, Nagaland government, and ENPO have signed an agreement to establish the Frontier Nagaland Territorial Authority (FNTA) to address the demands of Eastern Nagaland. Union Home Minister Amit Shah stated the MHA will fund the new body and ensure development in the region, marking progress towards peace and development in the Northeast.

What exactly is a laminate? 6 things to know about it
description: Laminates are more than just a surface finish. They are engineered material systems that define how interiors perform and last. Modern laminates offer advanced durability, hygiene, and safety features. They adapt to changing design trends and lifestyles. This makes them a practical and reliable choice for homes and commercial spaces. Laminates are also increasingly made with sustainability in mind.

description: Cristiano Ronaldo, a global football icon, continues to defy age with his unparalleled goalscoring prowess and relentless ambition. Beyond the pitch, his commercial empire solidifies his status as a sporting billionaire, proving his hunger for greatness remains undimmed.

16 dead in Meghalaya 'illegal' coal mine blast; several feared trapped
description: Tragedy struck Meghalaya's East Jaintia Hills as an explosion at a suspected illegal coal mine claimed at least 16 lives on Thursday. Several others remain trapped as rescue operations are underway. Officials confirmed the blast occurred in the Thangsku area, with one injured labourer hospitalized. The incident highlights the dangers of unscientific mining practices.

description: India captain Suryakumar Yadav confirmed the team will head to Colombo for their T20 World Cup match against Pakistan, despite uncertainty. Google CEO thinks bloodbath in markets in reaction to Anthropic is overblown
description: Google CEO Sundar Pichai and Nvidia's Jensen Huang dismiss market panic over AI plugins, calling it overblown.  Anthropic's new tools, particularly for legal tasks, triggered significant stock drops.  Pichai views AI as an enabling tool, while Huang argues it will enhance, not replace, existing software, urging a focus on core competencies.

title: ‘Salman Khan walked in a club and paid every guest’s bill, handed free champagne bottles,’ recalls blogger
Ghaziabad sisters' suicide: 'Death better than beatings', daughters wrote in diary
description: Three sisters, aged 16, 14, and 12, died after falling from the ninth floor of their Ghaziabad apartment building. A neighbor witnessed the eldest sister on the window ledge with the younger two holding her, before they all fell. Police are investigating, with a diary and mobile phone recovered from the puja room.

title: Gujarat man arrested in US for human trafficking, sexual crimes
description: A 42-year-old Gujarat man, Vikas Patel, was arrested in Kentucky, USA, on charges including human trafficking, sexual abuse, rape, and theft by deception. Allegations from two women detail withheld wages and sexual assault, including commercial sexual activity with a minor. The investigation began after a complaint regarding employment and housing arrangements.

title: OpenAI sees exit of senior-level employees after CEO makes it compulsory to use ChatGPT
description: OpenAI is experiencing a significant exodus of senior researchers as CEO Sam Altman prioritizes ChatGPT development over long-term AI exploration.  Key figures, including a VP of research, have departed due to resource allocation disputes, with experimental projects reportedly sidelined.  This strategic shift, driven by intense competition, leaves some teams feeling marginalized and questioning their original research goals.

title: Dell sued by 5 ex-employees; complaint alleges that the company mismanaged its 401(k) plan
description: Five ex-Dell employees are suing the tech giant, alleging its 401(k) plan mismanagement cost workers over $318 million. The lawsuit claims Dell violated federal law by keeping workers in underperforming investment funds while profiting from its own products.  This class action seeks to recover losses and reform the retirement plan's operations.

title: Ayesha Curry speaks on resilience as Stephen Curry backs her amid trolling
description: Stephen Curry and his wife, Ayesha Curry, have been together ever since the two were young adults. Close to two decades of being together, Ayesha Curry has opened up about the life she has built for herself, away from her husband's fame and wealth. While Ayesha Curry has also faced a lot of hurdles in her life, Stephen Curry has stayed by her side.
